snippet: The foundation, formed in 1966 by the family that made its fortune in private security, has quietly given more than $300 million to children’s organizations in New York....
abstract: Pinkerton Foundation, which has quietly donated over $300 million to New York City youth-serving organizations since 1966, sheds its 'cloak of invisibility' with 50th anniversary party at New-York Historical Society and establishment of several programs that bear Pinkerton name.
lead_paragraph: The foundation, formed in 1966 by the family that made its fortune in private security, has quietly given more than $300 million to children’s organizations in New York.

headline.main: Pinkerton Foundation, Born of Detective Agency, Prefers to Work Unobserved
headline.print_headline: Celebrated for Its Good Will, but Preferring to Give Quietly
